episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and intriguing facts, including the use of a jet engine to dry a cricket pitch, a legal debate over whether stained glass windows are considered windows, the ownership of Hard Rock Cafe by a Native American tribe, and the unique anatomy of female seals that helps them during mating.

facts.fact: In 1954, Derbyshire Cricket Club tried drying out its pitch with a jet engine.
There's currently a court case going on in Ireland about whether stained glass windows are actually windows.
Hard Rock Cafe is owned globally by a group of Native Americans.
When female seals have sex, they have a special muscle in their vagina that can clamp around their partner to stop seawater from getting in.
